  • PS4
  • PS5

Due out this summer in Japan.

Compile Heart has announced side-scrolling action RPG Magical Librarian Ariana: The Book of Seven Heroes for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch, the latest issue of Weekly Famitsu reveals. It will launch this summer in Japan.

Magical Librarian Ariana: The Book of Seven Heroes is led by Aoki Hiroshi, who previously produced games like Rune Factory 5, Rune Factory 4 Special, and Dariusburst, and designed Psychic Force. It follows Ariana, who possesses the special ability to enter books. She uses a unique form of magic called âLibrarian Magic.â The game is not designed to be a game in which the player will die frequently, making it accessible and easy for anyone to play.

Further information will be revealed this spring.

Thanks, Ryokutya2089.

item.title: Cotton Reboot! High Tension! debut trailer, details, and screenshots
item.content:encoded:

  • PS4
  • PS5
  • Switch

Due out on July 24 in Japan.

BEEP has released the first trailer, information, and screenshots for side-scrolling shoot âem up and Cotton Reboot! sequel Cotton Reboot! High Tension!

Get the details below.

A sequel to the 2021-released Cotton Reboot! The gluttonous witch Nata de Cotton is back in action! Dig into this powered-up, exhilarating witch shoot âem up game!

This sequel to the side-scrolling shoot âem up Cotton Reboot! has been meticulously crafted from the ground up.

While âWillowsâ are an important item in the Cotton series, this time theyâve taken on a sinister form, plunging the fairy kingdom into chaos. Joining Cotton and Silk on this absurd adventure is the new character Macaron.

The gameplay is even more thrilling, with beautiful graphics and powerful new magic. Additionally, when you collect a certain number of items, youâll enter âOver Tension,â unlocking a level of âhigh tensionâ never-before-seen in the series.

  • â®

Along with returning classic magic like âFire Dragonâ and âLightning,â the game introduces a new attack system called âEnemy Capture,â which lets you use enemy characters to help clear each stage. The âFeverâ system from the previous game also returns, now enhanced as the more-exhilarating âWillow Fever.â

When your gauge reaches 100 percent, âOver Tensionâ will activate, doubling your score. Enemy attacks become more extreme, but you can use powerful hidden magic to significantly boost your score. Aim for the high score!

Former Namco composer Hiroyuki Kawada (known for works like Valkyrie no Bouken and Youkai Douchuki) and chiptune music unit YMCK are composing the stage music. The game will be further elevated with new tracks by this exceptional composition team.

The voice cast was chosen from over 200 applicants who auditioned.

Cotton Reboot! High Tension is due out for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and Switch on July 24 in Japan. The PlayStation 5 and Switch versions will be available both physically and digitally in 6,380 yen standard and 10,780 yen limited editions, while the PlayStation 4 version will be digital-only. The limited edition includes an original teacup, instruction card, original booklet, and soundtrack CD, all housed in an treasure chest-style original box.

item.title: Farland Saga I & II Saturn Tribute announced for PS5, Switch
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/farland-saga-i-ii-saturn-tribute-announced-for-ps5-switch

  • PS5
  • Switch

Due out in 2025 in Japan.

City Connection has announced Farland Saga I & II Saturn Tribute for PlayStation 5 and Switch. It will launch in 2025 in Japan.

Here is an overview of the collection, via City Connection:

This is a collection including Farland Saga, a story about a journey for coexistence between humans and demons while caught up in a war between three nations, and Farland Saga: Toki no Michishirube, the sequel set eight years later, which depicts the struggle and grand destiny of a novice adventurer.

Battles are turn-based with an isometric view, featuring numerous units on the field, both allies and enemies. As you progress through the story, youâll be joined by a variety of unique characters, with whom you can enjoy lively conversations. Events also feature beautiful animated scenes.

New features include a guide function that displays easy-to-understand information during battle, such as items, magic, and both ally and enemy stats, as well as a function that doubles the experience points acquired.

Further information will be announced at a later date.

item.content:encoded:

  • PC
  • Switch

Featuring English, Japanese, and Chinese language options.

Boys love visual novel and The Town of Nie fan disc The Town of Nie: Iromusubi will launch for Switch and PC via Steam on May 22, publisher dramatic create and developer âZOMBILiCA announced. It will support English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, and Simplified Chinese language options.

The original The Town of Nie launched for Switch and PC via Steam worldwide on September 19, 2024.

Here is an overview of the fan disc, via dramatic create:

About

A fan disc of the strange and eerie otherworldly boys love fantasy The Town of Nie is now available for Switch and Steam!

This title is set about one year after the main story, and features epilogues for the lover partners, side stories told from the perspective of side characters, and episodes after the ending, which delves deeper into the characters and the world view.

In this port we plan to retain the charm of the original as much as possible, while making adjustments in line with the feel and spirit of The Town of Nie.

The Town of Nieâ¦ï¼

Hisora, the protagonist who works multiple blue-collar jobs, suddenly gets lost in a creepy world one day.

In order to find a way to return to his original world, he gets help from the residents of an Inn and enters a town where the dead live.

What awaits Hisora at the conclusion of this life-risking searchâ¦?

Ported Version Key Features

  • Background Music Listening Mode â Includes 21 songs in total, including songs from The Town of Nie: Iromusubi Mini Album.
  • Fully-Realized System â Enjoy the game with a comfortable control system.
  • Supported Languages â Japanese, English, Traditional and Simplified Chinese

Story

Our main character, Hisora, spent his days working his blue-collar jobs every day without a moment to rest. One day, he followed a man in mourning clothes and ended up getting lost in an eerie world.

It has been about one year of Hisora searching for a way back home while staying at the Inn â the season is now summer.

While he still has not found a way back to the real world, Hisora has come to enjoy his life together with the residents of the Inn.

In the midst of these extraordinary days, an eerie shadow begins to haunt him.

Not wanting to burden anyone, Hisora does not share this with the others, and begins to live in anxietyâ¦

This is a tale of bright, hot summer days.

item.title: Compile Heart and Neilo release teaser trailer for third-person shooter to be announced on January 30
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/compile-heart-and-neilo-release-teaser-trailer-for-third-person-shooter-to-be-announced-on-january-30

  • PC
  • PS4
  • PS5

A brief first look.

Publisher Compile Heart and developer Neilo have announced third-person shooter Scarlet Salvation for PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, and PC. it will launch on May 29 in Japan for 8,580 yen. A limited edition will also be available for 12,980 yen.

Scarlet Salvation is described as a challenging game led by Hiroshi Aoki, who previously produced games like Rune Factory 5, Rune Factory 4 Special, and Dariusburst, and designed Psychic Force. Hiroshi joked that one of his previous games, Global Champion (Kaiser Knuckle in Japan), also ended up having a high difficulty. Despite its difficulty, Scarlet Salvation has been adjusted to be easy to play without stumbling over the controls.

The protagonist, Willow Martin (voiced by Fairouz Ai), has no memory of her past, but when a fight begins, her body moves naturally and she displays exceptional combat abilities. Another character, AI (voiced by Junichi Suwabe), also appears.

Willow has access to 10 different weapon types, including flashy ones typical of science-fiction. These weapons can also be upgraded. There are teleportation-like movements and parrying mechanics as well.

Dungeons are randomly generated. When you die, your weapons and levels are lost, but a mysterious number on your face increases.

While the announcement itself is only available in Famitsu as of now, Compile Heart also released a teaser trailer and opened a teaser website. The teaser trailer features Willow, with the number â00001â on her face, engaged in combat against mechanical weaponry.

Watch the teaser trailer below. An official announcement is planned for January 30.

item.title: Sony Interactive Entertainment appoints Hideaki Nishino as president and CEO
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/01/sony-interactive-entertainment-appoints-hideaki-nishino-as-president-and-ceo

  • PlayStation

Hiroki Totoki to succeed Kenichiro Yoshida as Sony Group Corporation president and CEO.

Sony Interactive Entertainment has appointed Hideaki Nishino as president and CEO, effective April 1, 2025, the company announced. Nishino was previously appointed Platform Business Group CEO alongside Studio Business Group CEO Hermen Hulst on June 1, 2024. Hulst will continue to serve as CEO of the Studio Business Group and report to Nishino.

âI am truly honored to take the helm at Sony Interactive Entertainment,â Nishino said in a press release. âTechnology and creativity are two of our biggest strengths as we continue to focus on developing experiences that deliver entertainment for everyone. We will continue to grow the PlayStation community in new ways, such as [intellectual property] expansion, while also delivering the best in technology innovation. I want to thank Hermen for his expertise and leadership as he continues his role as CEO, Studio Business Group. I am deeply grateful for the PlayStation community and their continued support and I am very excited for what the future holds.â

Nishino will also continue to serve as CEO of the Platform Business Group, while Hulst will continue to lead the development, publishing, and business operations of Sony Interactive Entertainmentâs first-party content.

Sony Group Corporation and Sony Interactive Entertainment also announced that Sony Group Corporation president, chief operating officer, and chief financial officer Hiroki Totoki will step down from his position as Sony Interactive Entertainment chairman to become president and CEO of Sony Group Corporation, succeeding current president and CEO Kenichiro Yoshida, who will become director, representative corporate executive officer, and chairman.

Lin Tao, who is currently serving as senior vice president of finance and corporate development and strategy for Sony Interactive Entertainment, will step down from her position to become chief financial officer of Sony Group Corporation. Taoâs successor at Sony Interactive Entertainment will be announced at a later time.

âIt has been a pleasure working more closely with Hermen and Nishino and gaining insight into the ever-changing, fast-paced world of Sony Interactive Entertainment,â said Totoki. âAs we hand the baton to Nishino and this exceptional leadership team, I am confident that [Sony Interactive Entertainment] will reach new heights in the days ahead. After 30 years of delivering exceptional entertainment worldwide, this marks an exciting new chapter for [Sony Interactive Entertainment], highlighting its commitment to fostering creativity and building meaningful connections for millions of players. I am delighted to welcome Lin as my successor as [chief financial officer] of Sony Group Corporation. Lin has been instrumental to our success at [Sony Interactive Entertainment], leading the Finance, Corporate Development and Strategy functions, and I look forward to working closely with her at Sony Group Corporation.â

Kenichiro Yoshida added, âTo ensure that my succession contributes to Sonyâs future long-term growth, I have been in discussion with the Nominating Committee and the Board of Directors for some time. Based on Hiroki Totokiâs contributions to Sony, including his achievements since being appointed as President and COO in April 2023, I proposed to them that he succeed me as CEO this April. I am grateful to the Nominating Committee and the Board for their support of this proposal. Totoki has been a key member of the management team ever since I became President and CEO in April 2018. He spearheaded growth strategies for the Sony Group, such as our investments in content IP and semiconductors, and is a leader capable of shaping our vision and strategy for future growth. Going forward, I will support Totoki as he leads his new management team.â
